name: Emily Dickinson
what_did:
Emily Dickinson wrote short, thoughtful poems about nature, life, and feelings.
She lived a quiet life and didn’t publish many poems while alive.
After she died, people found hundreds of her poems — and she became famous.
why_matters:
Emily Dickinson changed how people thought poetry could look and sound.
Her unique voice and deep thoughts helped shape American literature.
Her poems are still read and loved today.

questions.q: Was she famous during her life?

options: They are deep and use strange dashes

fun_fact: Emily Dickinson loved wearing white and often stayed inside her house, writing poems in secret.
